TopicTitle: Round-8 Toroidal fuel tank in Ion Propulsion Node

Articles.Content: I'm not sure if this is a bug or if it's intended, but while looking at the tech tree, I saw that the Round-8 Toroidal fuel tank was in the "Ion Propulsion" node of the tech tree, among the ion engine and the xenon tanks. But if we hover the mouse cursor over it the info window says it contains liquid fuel and oxidizer, so what on earth is this tank doing in such a node ?? ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif) It should be located in the "Propulsion systems" node with the Oscar-B tank and the two tiny engines, unless you wanted to make it a xenon tank too ?

To my memory, that tank *should* be a xenon tank, unless I missed something. You may want to try deleting its associated files from your KSP directory and then (if you have the Steam version) verifying the game cache to redownload the correct files, or (if you have a version from the KSP store) running the patcher to redownload the latest version of those files. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you're not sure where those files are, you can also simply delete the GameData\Squad folder and then have Steam or the KSP Patcher redownload the files.

> 
> To my memory, that tank *should* be a xenon tank, unless I missed something. You may want to try deleting its associated files from your KSP directory and then (if you have the Steam version) verifying the game cache to redownload the correct files, or (if you have a version from the KSP store) running the patcher to redownload the latest version of those files. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> If you're not sure where those files are, you can also simply delete the GameData\Squad folder and then have Steam or the KSP Patcher redownload the files.

Have you perchance completely avoided the forums between the time the Round-8 was mentioned to be turned into a Xenon tank, and the time when the **massive community campaigns** against the change caused Squad to make a new large tank for Xenon instead? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I can confirm the issue. It seems that the tank was reverted to LFO, but its position in the tech tree was forgotten.
